etymologies: late Old English spīthra, from spinnan (see spin)

definitions: an eight-legged predatory arachnid with an unsegmented body consisting of a fused head and thorax and a rounded abdomen. Spiders have fangs that inject venom into their prey, and most kinds spin webs in which to capture insects.
used in names of arachnids similar or related to the spider, e.g., sea spider, sun spider.
shortDefinitions: used in names of arachnids similar or related to spiders

definitions: an object resembling a spider, especially one having numerous or prominent legs or radiating spokes.
a long-legged rest for a billiard cue that can be placed over a ball without touching it.
shortDefinitions: long-legged rest for billiard cue that can be placed over ball without touching it

definitions: a cast-iron frying pan, originally made with legs for cooking on coals in a hearth.
shortDefinitions: cast-iron frying pan, originally made with legs for cooking on coals in hearth

definitions: move in a scuttling manner suggestive of a spider

examples.text: a treecreeper spidered head first down the tree trunk

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: move in scuttling manner suggestive of spider

definitions: form a pattern suggestive of a spider or its web

examples.text: a system of tunnels spider through the district

shortDefinitions: form pattern suggestive of spider or its web

crossReferenceMarkers: another term for crawl (sense 4 of the verb)

examples.text: when the search engines spider your site they'll find all of the pages
